content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, x squared, times e raised to the negative x squared, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. At what values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have a relative maximum?

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
